runs.comm: well, the good news for England is that their stand-in keeper, Solanki, takes that with no worries. The bad news is that it was speared down the leg-side
even wider down the leg-side. But zippier at least.
on leg-stump this time, and another extra, this time off the pad
this is verging on the rubbish from Anderson. Four consecutive leg-side deliveries, and this time the deflection takes the ball over the ropes
that's a better line - middle and middle-and-off, and pushed out to midwicket
tighter again from Anderson, McCullum comes forward and defends
faster and back of a length, pushed into the covers off the back foot

there's the breakthrough, and it's the reserve keeper Solanki who takes the catch! Short of a length and fast from Anderson, McCullum swished loosely off the back foot, but found only a thin edge. The chance was taken comfortably enough - Anderson, all is forgiven
nice tight line outside off stump, left alone
another good delivery - not much carry, strangely - but Vincent shoulders arms emphatically
full length and driven airily - Broad stuck out his left hand and came close to intercepting - but the ball flies down to long-off where it's picked up inside the rope
full and Vincent goes through with a chancy drive. Gets a bit of a leading edge on it, but it lands safe just out of the reach of long-on
shot! That was in the slot for the cover drive, and Vincent latched on in fine style. No stopping that one
Broad this time strays down the leg-side. Another comfortable take from Solanki
pushed into the covers. A decent first over from Broad
a genuine edge, but safe. The slip is far too deep, in the opinion of Nasser Hussain. That's probably because Solanki is stood further back than a regular keeper
full length and that's plumb! Fulton was looking to work that off the legs and through midwicket, but he missed. No dispute there. Another breakthrough for England
wide of the crease and angled in. Awkwardly defended down into the crease
good nip and lift off a good length. Taylor picks up a leg-bye as the ball bobbles into the gully region
back and across to defend with an angled bat, third man sweeps round to field inside the rope
good line and length once again. Excellent lift off the pitch, and Taylor this time picks up a single to third man
ripper. Perfect line and length, and bit of nip and bounce off the seam to beat the bat
not the worst delivery, but that was clobbered. Just a fraction too short, and Taylor targets the short leg-side boundary with a lofted swipe
short and a slash from Taylor, but he misses out this time
short of a length again. Taylor is on the charge but misses out again

that's a big wicket for England. Taylor was looking itchy out there. He tried to pick Anderson off a good length, but managed only a leading edge to a back-pedalling Flintoff in the covers. Three big wickets, and England are on top
pushed onto the back foot and defended into the gap
perfect from Flintoff. Uneasy length, tight line, great lift off the pitch. Vincent does well to miss it
fuller length and defended off the back foot. Great attacking pace so far
shorter and slashed wildly, it takes a slight top-edge but plugs safely between two fielders converging from third man and point
Styris is off the mark first ball with a nudge into the gap
good line and length again, but Flintoff is clearly hobbling at the end of each delivery. Sadly, that's the way of things these days
the end of another excellent over for Flintoff and England. Tidy and attacking stuff
a fraction short and a hint of width, but backward point picks up a backfoot steer with ease
full length, angled into the pads, pushed out to midwicket
lovely line and length again. Fizzes through to the increasingly confident Solanki
sharp single, the shy misses at the non-striker's end

full-length, angled in and that's another big wicket, and what's more, another comfortable take for the reserve keeper! "Solanki's like Godfrey Evans out there," screams David Lloyd, as well he might. England are all over it at the moment
right on the spot first ball, and the dangerous McMillan plays himself in
full length and tight line, through to the keeper with minimal fuss
too short, and swivel-pulled into the leg-side. No great timing however
short again but Styris can't time this one either. New Zealand are looking a little keen to get on with it at the moment. As well they might
fuller length, and driven to cover
elegant strike off the front foot, but well fielded at short cover, and another valuable dot ball
slower ball to finish the over. Styris picks it but doesn't time it, and long-on tidies up for another single. Good over for England
short of a length, and nudged out to point
defended off the front foot this time. Clever change of pace
lovely delivery. Outside off stump and climbing off the seam. Solanki takes well with a leap
good lift again, Styris attempts to waft round the corner, but can't make contact
excellent bowling, tempting but constraining and Styris can do nothing
a single at last, but nothing more than that as third man sweeps round to pick up. Well bowled Dimitri
nudged into the gap on the off side
line and length, and no width to play with. New Zealand are on the ropes
hustled into the covers, lots of shouting as the shy comes in but safe enough
a swish and a miss outside off stump. England have taken the pace off the ball at precisely the right time of this innings
full length, almost a yorker length, and dug out with a straight bat
floated up to the pads and whipped into the leg side to complete a very tidy over
that's massive. Just a little bit too short from Mascarenhas, and at his pace he can't afford to do that. Styris climbed into that and smacked it clean over the midwicket stand
slightly fuller, but that's the same result! Down on one knee and lots of bottom hand. One bounce off the roof of the midwicket stand and away into the road!
take that! Faster and flatter, but the same result. 666, the number of the beast!
wider of the stumps this time. Sensibly so
wider and fuller is the way forward, driven into the covers
wide of the crease and angled onto middle stump. A gentle push down the ground to keep the strike
floated and driven hard to deep mid-off, well picked up and returned with real zip
one step to make a full delivery into a full toss, driven to the man in the deep on the cover boundary
one step and leaved into the off side, it goes high and far but long-on and deep cover can't get there and it bounces harmlessly between them
now that he middled, same shot but that time he connected and it flew high and far into the crowd
pushed into the covers
back  on his stumps and flicked to deepish square leg
full toss and that got exactly what it deserved, smacked onto the roof of the stand beyond midwicket  and it's stuck up there
wider and flat-batted to deep cover
very wide, but McMillan reaches for it and just about manages to get a bat on it  and bump the ball into the ground from where it loops to Solanki
wide full toss, creamed through the covers, no chance of the man in the deep getting anywhere near that
slower and wide, McMillan heaves and misses and then mutters in the direction of the umpire ... he thought that should have been called
yorker-length but outside off, squirted down to third man
turned off his toes to Broad at short fine leg. "Well done, Broady," chirps Solanki
Styris throws everything into that slog but missed, Solanki takes
he connects at the second time of asking, Solanki yells "catch it" but it bounces safely between the men in the deep
swished into the leg side

Styris calls for a second to wide midwicket, Maddy picks up cleanly and scores a direct hit at the bowler's end and Styris is well short ... the umpire calls for the replay but Styris knows and he is heading off.
flicked of his pads to deep midwicket
super running, cut to third man and McMillan was sprinting back for the second even as the throw was on its way, the fielder was off balance and he spotted that and gambled
a more sedate single into the off
banged in, Oram ducks and the square-leg umpire signals that it was a wide and his colleague calls it. Anderson unamused, to say the least
patted square on the off side
slower  - 67mph - yorker-length but outside off, the bat jabs down and the ball bobbles into the off
Oram jumps and turns that into the leg side, he ambles the run while his partner is always more alert to the chances of a second
full and outside off, hit on the half volley to deep extra cover
and that really is massive ... hit straight and far, into the second tier of the stand and to the biggest boundary as well
heaved to leg towards cow corner, it falls short and Maddy slides and flicks the ball back as he hits the boundary marker ... referred to the third umpire but that was good fielding
well improvised, a bouncer that he helped on its way to the third-man boundary. He really reached for that and played what was almost a tennis shot
into the leg side, McMillan wanted two but it wasn't there
Oram drives to long-off, not really timed and he's not the fastest between the wickets either, so only the one
slanted in at the pads, McMillan misses with an attempted swish to leg
slow, Oram waits, pats it into the off side and scurries a single
outside off, heaved towards long-on, Pietersen runs in bit can't quite get to the ball as it bounces a yard in front of him
McMillan opens his arms and slashed that through extra cover, well placed and timed as well
he brings up his fifty off 27 balls by launching Collingwood over square leg into the grassy knoll
groundhog day ... heaved over midwicket ten rows back
driven up the ground to long-off and, crucially, he keeps the strike
McMillan slightly cramped and can't get it away
a step to leg and McMillan slams that high but not with enough power to clear long-off
Oram slashes a wide ball inches over a leaping extra cover and there's nobody out there to mop up
an ugly heave, Oram misses and Maddy has two wickets in three balls. A cry of anguish from Oram as the stumps are clattered
"bowled Dazzler" says Solanki as Bond can only paddle the ball down the ground for a single
again a single to long-off
offcutter, Vettori back and pulls to square leg, well stopped on the boundary by Flintoff, showing unusual agility
back, steered with an open bat face into a gap on the off side
slower, chipped back over the bowler, long-off chugs round to field
right up on the crease, Bond tries to angle the ball behind square on the off but misses and loses his off stump. Good variation of pace, the previous ball was slower, this was quicker
again right up in the blockhole, driven back to Collingwood who stoops and fields
full toss, pushed to Flintoff at deep cover
fast, full and straight, defensive push to deep extra cover
full toss patted to extra cover, he picks up well and misses with a throw at the non-striker's end
defended into the covers
Vettori scampers two paces to the off, Flintoff sees him going (he did start off midway through his run-up) and follows him, Vettori can only steer into the leg side for the one
full, driven down the ground, wide enough of long-on to allow them to come back for the second
full, driven back at Flintoff who leaps to field
Vettori shimmies to leg, gives himself room and drives to long-off
short and nasty, Bond jumps and fends it down into the off side, no pace on the ball and that allows the single as the fielders are back on the circle
again Vettori skips to the off side very early, Broad bowls a full toss and Vettori eases it behind square on the leg side. The gamble pays off ...
again Vettori walks to the off and this time helps the ball much finer on the leg side ... it went over his off stump, so far across had he gone
he steps to the leg this time and drives on the half volley over the covers, Mascarenhas fields a yard in from the rope
yorker length, Gillespie jams down and sends the ball zipping to deep backward point, he attempts to come back for a second but is run out by a country mile
